availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eliza Jane Bodkin (Ballard County, Kentucky, resident.)

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Daniel Bodkin in Shelby County, Kentucky, on October 28, 1849. Mother of Byron Bodkin, Alice Bodkin, Daniel Bodkin, Jr., Mary T. Bodkin, Olive F. Bodkin, and Eliza Bodkin. Resident of Ballard County in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1850. Resident of Ballard County in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 5, p. 442B.
Thomas M. Bodkin, "Bodkin," in Ballard and Carlisle Counties History, Volume I, ed. Ballard-Carlisle Historical-Genealogical Society (Dallas, TX: Taylor Publishing Company, 1993), pp. 19-20.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film 000259290.
